document.topic_text: 9 Home Decor Pieces You Should Never Splurge On April 25, 2016 12:56 pm by Grace Beuley Hunt Expand From the windows to the walls . . . to the mélange of decor inside them, stylishly outfitting a home will best even the most fiscally responsible of decorators. With such a great abundance of items to choose from—and the ease of the Internet in both sourcing and acquiring them (what did we do before Pinterest boards?)—the struggle to buckle down and budget when decorating a dream pad, no matter the square footage, has become increasingly real. While many aptly dubbed “investment pieces” (think a classic sofa and a high-quality mattress) do in fact necessitate splurge purchasing, thankfully there is hope yet for savvy spenders. Here, nine areas of home decor where wallet-friendly options are not only a possible solution, but indeed the preferable one. 1 / 9 Routine isn’t always glamorous, but it can still be chic. CB2 Under Line dinnerware, from $4, cb2.com Photo: Courtesy of CB2 2 / 9 Dining Chairs Consider comfort and aesthetic, but since you’re dealing with multiples, leave the serious seating investments to statement pieces and those in which you spend lengthy amounts of time. Industry West Taka side chair, $145, industrywest.com Photo: Courtesy of industrywest.com 3 / 9 Decorative Accents Ornamental flourishes (looking at you, throw pillows) can carry exorbitant price tags. When stunning options are available without the sticker shock, switching them up from time to time is all the more fun. Local + Lejos La Laguna pillow, from $34, localandlejos.com Photo: Courtesy of localandlejos.com
